title: Shoulda Named It After Me
lyrics:
Yeah I was burning tread on a Ford flatbed before I ever turned 16
[?] Daisy Duke girl in this country boy [?] shotgun, see
That liquor store with the cash on the drawer looked past my fake ID
I say, everybody knows everybody, but they sure as hell know me
In that map dot town, 65 south bound

In the middle of Tennessee

Yeah I left black marks on every turn too sharp

Like Bo Duke in General Lee

With all the hell I raised on these Cheatham County lanes

Left some 'Church on every street

Every field, every road, every copperhead in Copperhead Creek

Shoulda named it after me



Sprayed my last name with some [?] paint on a broke down train downtown

Been covered up with some rain and some rust but damn it still stands out



In that map dot town, 65 south bound

In the middle of Tennessee

Yeah I left black marks on every turn too sharp

Like Bo Duke in General Lee

With all the hell I raised on these Cheatham County lanes

Left some 'Church on every street

Every field, every road, every copperhead in Copperhead Creek

Shoulda named it after me



Let's start this Sunday morning, sun shining right down

Up here in Cheatham county, yeah, we have a 'Church now

I'm gonna go tell y'all what, y'all better gather round

You've got the legend with the future, ain't it right now

We'd use some country boy spitting a little game on 'em

When you read the history books I bet you'll see our name on 'em

Sing, 'Church



Like my map dot town, 65 south bound

In the middle of Tennessee

Yeah I left black marks on every turn too sharp

Like Bo Duke in General Lee

With all the hell I raised on these Cheatham County lanes

Left some 'Church on every street

Every field, every road, every copperhead in Copperhead Creek

Shoulda named it after me

Shoulda named it after me
